result.execSummary:
The defendant Evan David Hakes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Evan David Hakes is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Evan David Hakes was found guilty of Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to sign up for Probation.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Minot, ADA: Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman   DF:  Evan David Hakes appeared from jail. Includes 15CF591 and 15CF35. Case called at 3:52 pm. There is an agreement. Count #4 in 15CF591. ADA Minser recites agreement. Count #3 in 15CF35. On 15CF591,  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Count #4. Court questions Defendant.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts.  Court finds Defendant Guilty of Count #4. Court dismisses Counts #1, #2, #3 and #5. St. Croix County Sheriff Case #201510555 read in and dismissed. Parties make sentencing arguments. Court orders On 15CF591, - 3yrs probation w/h with conditions. 
- 180 Days Jail STAYED. Huber for work and treatment
- Court Costs - $268.00
- DNA Surcharge - $250.00 Apply Bond
- Restitution payable to Maurices in Hudson. $100.00
- AODA
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- DNA Sample 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to possess a firearm
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- Apology Letter within 30 Days
- Sign up for probation
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- The Defendant may have to apply for Drug Court
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees


15CF35, 3 yrs probation w/h

Probation on15CF591 and 15CF35 to run concurrent.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes Agent Volz also appeared.   DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman   DF:  Evan David Hakes appeared. Includes 15CF35, 15CF69 and 15CF591. Case called at 10:04 am. ADA Nieskes makes statements. Def will not contest the Motion on 15CF69. On 15CF35 Counts #2 and #4 and Count #1 in 15CF69, Agent Volz makes statement she is recommending to have sentences run concurrent. ADA Nieskes makes recommendations.   Atty Chapman responds. Defendant makes statement. Court revokes DJOC and enters conviction on Count #3 in 15CF35. Court orders:
- 15CF69 Count 1 - 4 months - concurrent
- 15CF35 Count 2 -  6 months - consecutive
- 15CF35 Count 4 - 30 Days consective 
- for a total of 10 months jail
- 107 Days credit
- Unpaid Costs to be converted to a civil judgment. 
- Court will not grant Huber at this time.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Marie J.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-Not to possess any weapons. 

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Defendant appeared via video conferencing from the St Croix County jail.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Ferrill, ADA: Megan Kelly, Def Atty: Joe Caton, Def appears from jail via VC. Court reviews Probable cause and sets bond. INIT set for 12/28/15 @ 1:00 with EFV.

*Update Court with address. 
*Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
*Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.
*It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Marie Johnson.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
